author: bridge-bot
content:
<kevaundray> Speaking with Carl: 

The Verifier takes in a list of update proofs with the prestate and post-state. However, an equality check is never done to ensure post_state[n] == pre_state[n+1]. This is not right, diverges from the github spec's and will changed. The UpdateProof struct will now hold the post-state and the public key. The prestate will be passed in as an argument.

For reference, See this line: https://github.com/crate-crypto/ceremony-specs/blob/master/srs_updates.py#L17

author: bridge-bot
content: <kevaundray> We would still need to do one equality check on the last post-state to ensure it equals to the final SRS
